subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Black Death and the Crisis of Faith
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: The Black Death and the Crisis of Faith.

hook.text: A third of Europe died. Prayers didn't help. The Black Death shattered medieval faith like nothing before or since.

buildup.text: The plague arrived in 1347 and killed roughly 25 million Europeans in five years. Entire villages vanished.

discovery.text: The Church had no answers. Priests died alongside everyone else. If God was just, why this? Faith cracked.

twist.text: Some turned to extreme penance â€” flagellants whipped themselves. Others blamed Jews, triggering pogroms.

climax.text: The plague weakened Church authority and planted seeds of doubt that would bloom into the Reformation 150 years later.

punchline.text: The plague killed a third of Europe. Church authority never fully recovered.

quiz.question: How did the Black Death affect Christianity?
options: It weakened Church authority and planted seeds of doubt
